translation: People will also recount your everlasting dishonor; and for one who has been honored, dishonor is worse than death.
commentary: 2.34 Disgrace dishonour? f and? Even also? Bhootani beings? will tell will tell? And thy? Infinitive everlasting? of the potential of the honoured? f and? Disgrace: dishonour? from death than death? Atirichyate exceeds.Commentary The world also will ever recount thy infamy which will survive thee for a long time. Death is indeed preferable to disgrace to one who has been honored as a great hero and mighty warrior with noble alities.
